revised_title: Patrick Buxton: A Life in Natural History and Medicine
tldr: Patrick Buxton was a naturalist and medical doctor from a family with a strong history of philanthropy, business, and science. He pursued his interests in natural history and medicine, studying insects, zoology, and physiology at Cambridge and later working in various locations, including Iraq, Palestine, and Samoa. Buxton made significant contributions to the understanding of insect biology and disease control, as well as the study of desert and semidesert faunas.
